comments:
Hi there, I've started working in AspectJ recently, but I'm having a problem with using AJDT in Linux.

First, I've tried to use the "Software updates" functionality to install AJDT without any sucess (I get the following message: "No features on the selected site(s). Choose a different site or site category").
Second, I've downloaded the AJDT ZIP file and uncompressed its content to the 'features' and 'plugins' directories of eclipse. None of the AJDT features are present in Eclipse after this, nor opening an existing AspectJ project in the workspace. (This procedure did work in Windows though.)

I'm using JDK SE 1.5.0, Eclipse 3.2.1 (GTK) and AJDT 1.5.2. I've tried to install AJDT in two different Linux distributions (Fedora Core 4 and Ubuntu 5.10), so I don't believe that this should a distro specific problem.

In the "~/workspace/.metadata/.log" file I found the following:

Created an attachment (id=51857)
The eclipse log file.
Please can you give the exact URL for the update site you tried, and the full zip file version you downloaded.

We test frequently on Linux and I've just tried with a clean install of Eclipse 3.2.1 (GTK), and added an update site URL of 
   http://download.eclipse.org/tools/ajdt/32/update
for the release version of AJDT 1.4 of Eclipse 3.2.
It installed okay and appears to run properly.
Can you try again using this update site URL?
Tried again and it did work (clean install). Strange, since I've used the same URL. Maybe some problem with the update server in the day that I tried that. Or I just screwed up something :)
